form.label: HOWTO LPAR: Generate stats and charts with Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) for IBM Pseries micro-partitions
form.description: This collection of request samples will help you generating your own reports, dashboards and alerts for Nmon Performance data using the native Search Processing Language

h2.a: CPU Usage Statistics for IBM PSeries Micro-Partitions

panel.title: Optionally preset frameID and/or hostname and press Enter:
Time oriented and statistics oriented charts:

div.h2: Micro-Partitions Max CPU Usage in VP Usage calculated over VP for last 24 hours with auto span custom definition: (no limits in number of series, don't generate OTHER field)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | timechart useother=f limit=0 `nmon_span` max(vp_usage) AS vp_usage by hostname

div.h2: Micro-Partitions Max CPU Usage in VP Usage calculated over VP with Entitlement and Virtual CPUs series for last 24 hours with auto span custom definition: (no limits in number of series, don't generate OTHER field)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | timechart useother=f limit=0 `nmon_span` max(vp_usage) AS vp_usage, max(entitled) AS entitled, max(virtualCPUs) AS virtualCPUs by hostname

div.h2: Micro-Partitions Max CPU Usage in Percentage overs its VP capacity (calculated over VP, virtual CPUs numbers as its capacity limit) for last 24 hours with auto span custom definition: (no limits in number of series, don't generate OTHER field)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_Pct_usage=round((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT),2) | timechart useother=f limit=0 `nmon_span` max(vp_Pct_usage) AS vp_Pct_usage by hostname

div.h2: Micro-Partitions Max CPU Usage in VP Usage calculated over EC (shared partitions only) for last 24 hours with auto span custom definition: (no limits in number of series, don't generate OTHER field)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval ec_usage=round(((EC_User_PCT+EC_Sys_PCT+EC_Wait_PCT+EC_Idle_PCT)*entitled/100),2) | timechart useother=f limit=0 `nmon_span` max(ec_usage) AS vp_usage by hostname

div.h2: Micro-Partitions Max CPU Usage in VP Usage calculated over EC (shared partitions only) with Entitlement and Virtual CPUs series for last 24 hours with auto span custom definition: (no limits in number of series, don't generate OTHER field)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval ec_usage=round(((EC_User_PCT+EC_Sys_PCT+EC_Wait_PCT+EC_Idle_PCT)*entitled/100),2) | timechart useother=f limit=0 `nmon_span` max(ec_usage) AS ec_usage, max(entitled) AS entitled, max(virtualCPUs) AS virtualCPUs by hostname

div.h2: Micro-Partitions Max CPU Usage in Percentage overs its VP capacity (calculated over EC, virtual CPUs numbers as its capacity limit, shared partitions only) for last 24 hours with auto span custom definition: (no limits in number of series, don't generate OTHER field)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval ec_Pct_usage=round((((EC_User_PCT+EC_Sys_PCT+EC_Wait_PCT+EC_Idle_PCT)*entitled)/virtualCPUs),2) | timechart useother=f limit=0 `nmon_span` max(ec_Pct_usage) AS ec_Pct_usage by hostname

div.h2: Compare yesterday CPU Usage (evaluated over VP) versus today usage: (auto span definition)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | timechart `nmon_span` max(vp_usage) AS vp_usage_yesterday | appendcols [ search eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ earliest="@d" latest="now" | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | timechart `nmon_span` max(vp_usage) AS vp_usage_today | fields - _time ]

div.h2: Aggregation of CPU Usage (evaluated over VP) by frameID: (auto span definition)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | bucket _time span=1m | stats sum(vp_usage) AS vp_usage by _time,frameID | timechart `nmon_span` max(vp_usage) AS vp_usage by frameID

div.h2: Gauge chart of average CPU Percentage Usage (Percentage evaluated over VP usage and capacity) over last 24 hours
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_Pct_usage=round((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT),2) | stats avg(vp_Pct_usage) AS vp_Pct_usage | eval vp_Pct_usage=round(vp_Pct_usage,2)

div.h2: Gauge chart of average CPU Usage in VP (evaluated over VP) over last 24 hours with dynamic gauge values evaluated over virtual CPUs
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | gauge avg(vp_usage) AS vp_usage [ search eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | stats max(virtualCPUs) AS max | eval first=0 | eval second=(max*0.50) | eval third=(max*0.75) | eval fourth=max | eval second=round(second,0) | eval third=round(third,0) | eval fourth=round(fourth,0) | eval range=first+" "+second+" "+third+" "+fourth | return $$range ]

div.h2: Column chart of TOP 10 average CPU Percentage Usage (Percentage evaluated over VP usage and capacity) over last 24 hours
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_Pct_usage=round((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT),2) | stats avg(vp_Pct_usage) AS vp_Pct_usage by hostname | sort - vp_Pct_usage | head 10 | eval xlabel="" | chart useother=f limit=0 values(vp_Pct_usage) AS "Avg CPU %" by xlabel,hostname | rename xlabel AS "TOP 10 CPU % usage"

div.h2: Min / Average / Max CPU Usage in VP (evaluated over VP) over last 24 hours ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | stats min(vp_usage) AS "Min VP CPU usage", avg(vp_usage) AS "Avg VP CPU usage", max(vp_usage) AS "Max VP CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg VP CPU usage"=round('Avg VP CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max and Average sparkline of CPU Usage in VP (evaluated over VP) over last 24 hours ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | stats min(vp_usage) AS "Min VP CPU usage", avg(vp_usage) AS "Avg VP CPU usage", max(vp_usage) AS "Max VP CPU usage", sparkline(avg(vp_usage)) As sparkline by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg VP CPU usage"=round('Avg VP CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for Business days only (monday to friday, 24hrs / 24hrs) ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") | stats min(vp_usage) AS "Min VP CPU usage", avg(vp_usage) AS "Avg VP CPU usage", max(vp_usage) AS "Max VP CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg VP CPU usage"=round('Avg VP CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for Working hours Business days only (monday to friday, 08h to 19h) ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") AND (local_time>="0800" AND local_time<="1900") | stats min(vp_usage) AS "Min VP CPU usage", avg(vp_usage) AS "Avg VP CPU usage", max(vp_usage) AS "Max VP CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg VP CPU usage"=round('Avg VP CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Min / Average / Max of CPU Usage in Percentage over last 30 days for non Working hours Business days only (monday to friday, 19h to 08h) ordered and sorted by frame ID, hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (local_time>="1900" AND local_time<="2359") OR (local_time>="0000" AND local_time<="0800") AND (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") | stats min(vp_usage) AS "Min VP CPU usage", avg(vp_usage) AS "Avg VP CPU usage", max(vp_usage) AS "Max VP CPU usage" by frameID,hostname | eval "Avg VP CPU usage"=round('Avg VP CPU usage', 2) | sort frameID,hostname

div.h2: Compare Average CPU Usage in Percentage of previous month versus current month ordered and sorted by hostname
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ earliest="-1mon@mon" latest="@mon" | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | stats avg(vp_usage) As usage_period1 by hostname | append [ search eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ earliest="@mon" latest="now" | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | stats avg(vp_usage) As usage_period2 by hostname ] | stats values(*) AS * by hostname | `eval_compare`

div.h2: Use transaction to find servers having an average CPU usage higher than 90% for a minimal contiguous period of 5 minutes
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_Pct_usage=round((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT),2) | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | where vp_Pct_usage>90 | transaction hostname vp_Pct_usage maxpause=5m | where duration>300 | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration,vp_Pct_usage,vp_usage,entitled,virtualCPUs | stats values(*) AS * by _time,hostname | eval "duration (hh:mm:ss)"=tostring(duration,"duration") | rename duration AS "duration (seconds)" | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration*,vp_Pct_usage,vp_usage,entitled,virtualCPUs

div.h2: Use transaction to find servers having an average CPU usage higher than 90% for a minimal contiguous period of 5 minutes, restricted to Open hours and Business days (monday to friday, 08h to 19h)
div.pre: eventtype=nmon:performance type=LPAR frameID=$frameID$ hostname=$hostname$ | eval vp_Pct_usage=round((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT),2) | eval vp_usage=round(((VP_User_PCT+VP_Sys_PCT+VP_Wait_PCT+VP_Idle_PCT)*virtualCPUs/100),2) | eval date_wday=lower(strftime('_time', "%A")) | eval local_time=strftime('_time', "%H%M") | search (date_wday!="sunday" date_wday!="saturday") AND (local_time>="0800" AND local_time<="1900") | where vp_Pct_usage>90 | transaction hostname vp_Pct_usage maxpause=5m | where duration>300 | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration,vp_Pct_usage,vp_usage,entitled,virtualCPUs | stats values(*) AS * by _time,hostname | eval "duration (hh:mm:ss)"=tostring(duration,"duration") | rename duration AS "duration (seconds)" | fields _time,frameID,hostname,duration*,vp_Pct_usage,vp_usage,entitled,virtualCPUs
